intro: Cryptantha albida, commonly known as the white cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha albida is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
